title: Transfer news: Manchester United 'eyeing Russian striker Aleksandr Sobolev'
text:
Russian striker Aleksandr Sobolev has emerged as a January target for Manchester United as the club seek to bolster their forward options, according to The Sun.

The former Russian Under-21 star reportedly joins a shortlist of players including Callum Wilson, Mario Mandzukic and Moussa Dembele.

Old Trafford boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has admitted he needs to strengthen up front after letting Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez leave the club for Inter Milan in the summer.

Aleksandr Sobolev (R) is a target for Manchester United after impressing at Krylia Sovetov

Sobolev, 22, has impressed in the Russian Premier League with eight goals so far for Krylia Sovetov.

He has yet to make his senior debut for Russia, but would command a fee in the region of £15million - making him a cheaper option than the alternatives.

Bournemouth star Wilson would cost the Reds around £30million, but has impressed club scouts and has plenty of Premier League experience.
description: Russian striker Aleksandr Sobolev has emerged as a January target for Manchester United as the club seek to bolster their forward options.
